parse: Adverb
str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Preposition
str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Active
str2: To beat, strike, wound, inflict punishment.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: To whitewash, plaster over. From konia; to whitewash.

parse: Noun - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: A wall. Another form of teichos; a wall.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Preposition
str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Article - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To act contrary to law. From a compound of para and nomos; to be opposed to law, i.e. To transgress.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To beat, strike, wound, inflict punishment.
